subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Example Sentence
msgSnippet: Having been a great exponent of the Quick Brown Fox, I have been thinking along the same lines..... but it is definitely not easy! Good luck Moira ... -- Moira
messageBody:
Having been a great exponent of the Quick Brown Fox, I have been thinking along the same lines..... but it is definitely not easy!
 
Good luck
 
Moira

 
On 16/01/2008, cj_carlisle <cj_carlisle@...> wrote:

Although I am new to Quikscript, I am learning fast and enjoying
myself. I also am eager to share information about it with those
curious or interested.

I recall from learning to type (proper QWERTY ten-finger typing) we
used a sentence like "The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog."
to exercise our fingers on all 26 of the orthodox latin alphabet.
(Count 'em, they're all there!) This sentence is only 35 "letters"
long, covers the 26 requisite latin letters and is a great short
exercise to remember for typing.

Has anyone come up with a similar sentence which uses all 40 letters
of the Quikscript alphabet? Goals would include brevity, levity and
memorability.

This would be useful for both the handwritten and keyboard written
Quikscripter. I will try to come up with my own and hopefully have
some ideas posted soon.

-CJ




--
Moira O'Brien
